The battery life has drastically declined and it gets SO HOT that I can't use it, to be honest it's DANGEROUS. I've repeatedly asked them for a replacement or refund and implicated my legal rights as a consumer. Every email I send is answered with the same obstructive line about how my "12 month warranty has expired" and they are refusing to address anything I say about my consumer rights. It's deeply frustrating and unfortunately it seems that my only option is pursue legal action. Just bite the bullet and buy new, you'll be thankful that you did!Edit: Update in response to the reply they've given me below. You can clearly see a great example here of how they are refusing to acknowledge my consumer rights and are instead stonewalling me by constantly referring back to the expired warranty (which does not affect my rights as a consumer). Replacing a faulty product with another faulty product is not a viable solution. I have rejected the product for a refund, which I am entitled to do under the consumer rights act. REGARDLESS OF THE EXPIRED WARRANTY. Refusing to process that return is an obstruction of my rights. Please do not buy from this company.

I’m not sure if they have a head office or not or just a warehouse with a couple of staff but if they do have a head office they refuse to give details for it. Even after involving Trading Standards they are refusing to give the legally requested information or to attempt any resolution. I just want to warn others so they don’t have to go through the same miserable experience I did. 2.5 days spent waiting for and tracking delivery, hours of phone calls, a whole load of stress, £336 out of pocket plus the cost of the laptop at £500+I also noticed they had the exact same laptop/exact same specification advertised for a lower price elsewhere on their website and when I’ve looked on other sites subsequently the exact same spec laptops are available at lower prices and some with next day delivery. Review.Titre: Dodgy. Very unprofessional. Low quality. Do not buy.
Review.Contenu: We bought a refurbished PC for my son as a Christmas present. He's a child and it was his first computer, so we thought a refurbished computer was the best option, as it's cheaper. This company had good reviews, so we decided to go with them. Mistake.We received the computer quickly and it was well packaged. The first thing we realised was that everything was a different make: the tower, screen and screen stand. Not a big problem, but it did look quite cheap.The mouse and keyboard were light, cheap plastic. By looking at them we knew we would have to replace them soon.When we plugged it, we realised that the PC's language was set to French. Luckily, we are French speakers, so it was not a problem (other than the fact it was not what we had ordered), but we thought this could have been problematic for a different family. The computer was fairly slow to boot, but my son was so happy with his gift that he did not find it frustrating.We bought the PC for my son to play Minecraft. While he was playing in the evening of Christmas day, the computer's screen went black and a message appeared. It read : A disk read error occurred Press Ctrl + Alt + Del to restart. When we restarted, the same message appeared.I emailed Computer Discounts, to ask them what to do. They had no clue. They told me I should go and fiddle with System preferecences and reboot windows. I had no access to Windows. Some friends of mine are computer engineers. I asked them what to do and they said the disk was faulty (and that the people who refurbished the computer probably knew it) and there was nothing to be done, it needed binned and changed.The kerfuffle began. I think we must have exchanged about 70 emails. They would not answer my questions, they would write in such poor English that understanding what they meant was at times impossible. I wanted to talk on the phone, but they refused to give me a phone number.I live in Scotland. They told me that in order to return the computer, I would have to arrange my own courier, because their courier only deals with mainland UK. I had to write an email explaining to an adult that Scotland is indeed in mainland UK. Who are these people? A joke.The emails they sent me are so unbeliveable that I've kept them. If you want to have a look at them, contact me, a few weeks after the event, they're funny. Not at the time, though. At one point, they even told me how much margin they make on each computer, and explained that by organising the courier themselves, they would be making no money out of this sale. Why should I worry about this? How unprofessional!They also told me they 'expected my kind understanding' several times. Cheek! They are so aware of how ridiculous they look that at least three times they felt the need to add to their email 'we are a legitimate company'. Who does that but unprofessional dodgy businesses? It's like dealing with kids who'd be selling fake raffle tickets.It took days to arrange for their faulty computer to be sent away. I commend my wife who managed to understand their emails in spite of their lack of basic English writing skills. Weeks later, we were fully refunded, and went to a proper computer dealer and bought a proper computer. It works, looks good and sturdy. Because of this joke of a 'company' my son was so disappointed on Christmas day, but he is happy now.Do not buy from them, they are a farce.Edit: I was wondering how they get such good reviews. Yesterday, they sent me an email, offering me £10 to remove my negative review. Why not a Mars bar, or some marbles? This must be a bad BTEC project, surely. Legitimate companies don't pay to keep their customers misinformed. You don't need to have attended business school to know that that's a really dodgy marketing technique.People who do this don't hesitate to write their own positive reviews. Stay away.

I ordered the laptop which said delivery would be on 29 January, in time for my son's birthday on the 31st. I even said in the address confirmation email that it was a gift and hoped it would arrive in time. The reply was "it's the least we can do". I waited all day on Friday the 29th. No computer. I emailed to ask if it was still due to arrive that day. I was given some explanation about packing/delivery times etc. I told them it was stated on their site delivery for 29 January, which was why I ordered from them. The reply was due to circumstances they missed it by a day and we hope you can forgive us but good news it should be with you on Monday. Late. This ruined the day because the computer was his only gift. We were not impressed by the "oops, my bad" attitude.

Review.Titre: Old machines and Poor after sales support
Review.Contenu: Recently I bought a refurb SFF Dell 780 as a Gamer. The 16Gb RAM was OK but the cheap, entry level HD5450 Card was not. The OS, Win 10 did not function correctly, the system drivers were well out of date and the graphics were terrible. I reported this but was told it is a 'software problem' and not covered by the warranty. So I had to research and try to repair it all for myself. I have since learned that the Core 2 CPU is old hat these days and the SFF itself has limited upgrade potential, unless I buy Dell products. The company ignored my requests for advice in upgrading and refused to swap the unit for a similarly cost, better performance model. I shall not be using this company again. Too iffy by far.

Review.Titre: Had issues but was given refund
Review.Contenu: I bought a refurbished computer but it had several issues and wouldn't work. I contacted the company by e-mail and they responded quickly with advice and fixes I could try. In the end I decided that I wanted a refund as there were several issues that I'd have to keep trying fixes for. Obtaining the refund was simple and easy.So, it was a shame that the computer didn't work but the company provided good customer service to resolve this quickly.Edit: after leaving my intial 3 star review (see comments above), I was contacted by Computer Discounts on several occaisons asking that I change my review to 4 or 5 stars. I explained that I didn't feel that I could honestly do that and that I felt 3 stars was fair. However, they continued to request this - for this reason I feel I have to alter the review to 2 stars.

Review.Titre: Do you research to discover the standard of there current stock. The varied reviews suggest they get bad batches.
Review.Contenu: Bought a laptop from this company and within a few weeks it was not working at all. I returned at my own cost to have to fixed. I was told they would replace the machine. The exact same machine came back and didn't work. I was working overseas at this point and I had my family send it out to me. Naively I didn't ask them to check it was working. When I discovered it was the same machine I panicked. I question if they even looked at it. I contacted them and they apologised for the mistake. I was asked again to send back but at considerable cost which they wouldn't pay for even though this was an error on their part. When I returned to the UK I was promised I would have a refund if I sent the machine back to them which I did. I have no just received my refund which I am grateful for. They do seem to want to please the customer and on this instance I did receive my money back. Nether the less it took in excess of 50 emails and a lot of frustration to end the saga. Approach with caution although reviews would suggest they are improving. Maybe I bought from a bad batch of machine.

I bought a MacBook Pro 2015 from these guys and I'm not impressed. When I was debating buying the item, I spoke to quite a few customer service members who assured me that the machine would function as if it was brand new. I was also asked to pay £15 delivery and given a two day delivery date... Firstly, my MacBook didn't arrive on time because none of their machines in the UK were at selling quality, so they had it delivered to me straight from their warehouse IN DUBAI, which would have been okay except for the fact that no one told me.When the machine arrived it seemed okay (apart from being a little dirty and banged up) but upon usage I discovered three faults:1, a patch of dead pixels in the middle of the screen2, the SD card port doesn't work3, the battery life only lasts about 45 minutes (and that's using very basic programs like Word!) When I contacted their customer services to complain of these issues, I was told that all of these faults are "standard for refurbished machines"! Quite a turn around from "it will function as brand new! Save yourself the time and just get a brand new one.
Good communication delayed shipment but understandable in current situation
I am not very happy with the after service after buying a laptop
Defective Product and had to pay for the postage, to return.

Review.Titre: Mac Book Air wasn't as spec'd on Website
Review.Contenu: I do believe that this company is an honest seller. However there were a number of issues with my purchase. I purchased a refurbished Mac Book Air online on 14th December. When checking out the website advised that I would receive my order on 17th December. It was a Christmas present so this was fine. As I hadn't heard from them by the 17th I emailed customer service to be advised that it would be dispatched on the 18th December for delivery on 21st December. Again I heard nothing from them so emailed (There is no customer service telephone number so all communication is done by email) them on the 21st to be advised 'Good news, your order will be dispatched on 26th December for delivery on 29th December'. Obviously this would have been a disaster so some heated emailing then took place. Eventually the order was actually delivered on 23rd December so disaster averted! On delivery I opened the parcel to find a Mac Book Air in great condition. I did not start it up. So on Christmas day when the gift was opened it quickly became apparent that the advertised operating system had not been installed and instead an ancient OS was on there that would not load or run many apps or streaming services. It was also impossible to upgrade to a more up to date OS. After a few more email exchanges (response rates always very quick) they agreed to give me a refund. This came through today. This was my first (and probably last) foray into refurbed IT purchases and really wasn't great. The upshot was a lot of stress pre delivery and a disappointed child on Christmas day. They will not speak to you after you have placed your order but are always quick to respond to email enquiries. As stated I do believe they are a genuine seller and the customer service was good. However my overall experience has been poor as the product advertised was not what I received.
I would not recommend

The £ on shift 3  and I have just realized there is no "hash" key.On the plus side there is a DVD player which I wasn't expecting. I can cope with the changes in keys but will have to contact Computer Discount about the missing key.Not as satisfied as I thought I was!

Review.Titre: The delivery was very fast and exactly…
Review.Contenu: The delivery was very fast and exactly on time as per the delivery email.  My only reservation was the operating system.  I already own an iPad mini 3 purchased in 2014 that is up-to-date and runs on IOS 12.4.6.  However, the battery is beginning to have problems and the machine itself has to be reconnected to my broadband after any short interval of inactivity.  This new, refurbished iPad runs on IOS 9.3.5 and is obviously an earlier version of my 2014 machine.  This means that it is not compatible with iCloud which is not a problem for me but I wonder about its security.  I am happy with its speed and it has no problems with maintaining its broadband connection but I wonder if it will no longer have software updates and therefore become more susceptible to malware.  Your reassurance would be helpful.  Cheers.Mike Dobbie

Review.Titre: Great service - some missing information in product description
Review.Contenu: I bought a refurbished MacBook Air from this company. Most aspects of the purchase were very good - the website, order, speed of dispatch and hitting the target delivery date, which was just 3 days from when I ordered it I think. The packaging was good and the laptop itself was in good condition. An issue arose when I tried to install MS Office using my Office 365 Family Subscription - I couldn’t. It turned out the reason I couldn’t was because the laptop was running the MacOS called High Sierra. Office won’t install on anything older than Cortana and Cortana won’t install on any MacBook older than 2012. Unbeknown to me was that the refurbished laptop was 10 years old (2011). That’s not a problem in itself but if I’d known, I would not have purchased it, and the problem is that the age of the laptop was not stated anywhere in the product description. I returned the laptop at a cost of £22 postage. The returns process was perfect - their customer service is brilliant. I just think they should give all the facts about their refurbished equipment rather than wait for customers to discover important information after they’ve purchased.

Excellent service at point of sale and delivery, and great first impressions!I am cynical about online offers - if it looks too good to be true, then it usually is. However, on this occasion I was proved wrong. I put my faith in Computer Discounts and they didn't let me down. I've had my new (refurbished) MacBook Air 2017 for 2 weeks now and can honestly say it was a very positive experience buying from this company. The initial questions I had were answered by email promptly and clearly. I was kept informed about the process of preparation and delivery. The delivery was fast - 48 hours to an off-shore UK island. The laptop was in superb condition and easy to set up. So far, I am impressed. I say "so far" because I can't yet comment on any after-service processes or responses; I hope not to have to need to tbh.My only slight observation is that the packaging very clearly stated what was inside. I was a little surprised that it was so obvious as surely any "loss" in transit wouldn't be covered by their insurance if they are declaring to all who handle it (or trustingly leave it with a neighbour or in a "safe place" on delivery if you're out) that there is an expensive computer/device in the box; I'd expected it to be more discreet. Also sort of gives the game away if you're buying it as a gift for someone you live with.Yep - so far, would fully recommend this company :-)

Review.Contenu: I was looking for a new laptop for my business similar to my previous model with identical features such as sd card input, a few USB, CD/Video player basically all in one computer but still being portable. The new MacBook Pros 2020 on high street today are out of my pocket and Out of my need. I found a perfect solution after [chatting] with one of the staff at CD on possible options. I was hesitant at first why nobody would pick up the phone after several attempts trying to reach the company. I always prefer a human interaction especially when buying any gadgets, to ask a question as a reassurance for what tech terms means for example....because of that vital to me option was not available I will rate CD a good company. However I did get some limited correspondence and information  via emails regarding the stock, the models and delivery. It took 4 working days to receive my laptop. 2 days to get the order placed, hence absence of “human touch”.  I highly suggest to implement at least a what's up text and voice messages when possible.Gentleman from the delivery firm came all the way to the 4th floor to hand me in person my order, normally deliveries are left Inside the hall by the front door.Excellent service by the chosen delivery Firm, 5 star to the driver, 5 star for the price of my new MacBookPro that I paid only £380 for.The product functions very good, So far I am happy with the purchase but I'm still within my 1 year warranty, so time will show how long this type of technology will last. As this is my first time that I bought a used Technology from a third party.
Genuinely great machine that turned up! You cannot beat the value. Great customer service and very good product! Very happy
